title: Drawing, "Petites colonne placee entre les colonnes departmentales", 1838
title_raw: "Petites colonne placee entre les colonnes departmentales"
medium:
Brush and pen, watercolor, graphite
Support: light tan paper mounted on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed by a later hand in qraphite on mount, lower left margin: Petites colonnes plac es entre/les colonnes departementales, sur/ l'avenue des champs-elys es.
description: Design for a post, in which the main body is composed of a red and white striped polygonal column with two horizontal banding elements in blue and white, and which rests on a white base with two vertical red lines and a solid red bottom.  The main striped polygonal body of the post terminates in a gold acanthus capital with a plaque written with the number "29" on top, upon which rests golden scrollwork and a pentagram with a blue, white and red banner hanging above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Petites colonne placee entre les colonnes departmentales", 1838. Brush and pen, watercolor, graphite
Support: light tan paper mounted on off-white laid paper. 
1991-17-18
